page.title: 14THE SIKH TEMPLE
page.content: {by Permjit Ghataorre age 10 Our temple is{Ramgarhia Sikh Temple.} I go to the{Sikh Temple}nearly every week.The{temple}is on Foleshill Road. There are two sections in the{temple.} Upstairs is a prayer room and there is a big dining room downstairs.The {temple}has a committee which looks after the priest and the upkeep of the {temple},it buys the plates and spoons. Before you go upstairs you must take off your shoes.There are some sinks upstairs where you should wash your hands.There is a yellow carpet in the room where you pray.At the end of the room there is a carved wooden stand nearly as high as the roof,this is called the{Palkie}and this is where the priests sits and reads from the Holy Book or the{Granth Sahib.}The ladies sit on the left and the men on the right.Coventry has 15,000 Sikhs.
